results.title: The Sheep = La Pecora
results.brief_description: 15 wholesome minutes of playful ovine gambolling, as a father patiently answers his earnest young son’s many searching queries on the subject of sheep.

results.title: The Shearing table
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Corporation and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the shearing of sheep using mechanical shears. Old blad3 shears are compared with modern mechanical shears and both are seen in operation. A shearing table is examined, demonstrating the ease and comfort of a shearer using the table. Demonstrates the operation of a chain system of shearing in which a number of tables move around in a circle, each shearer working on a particular part of the sheep.

results.title: The Shearers
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Hugh Alexander
results.brief_description: Shearing teams are at work in different parts of Australia for most seasons of the year. This film tells the story of the shearers arriving at a typical sheep station and of their accommodation, the preparation of the various machines, combs and cutters - all of those things which must be attended to before the men begin work next morning.

results.title: The She-creature = The She creature
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Alex Gordon and Edward Cahn
results.brief_description: The lovely assistant of a mysterious and evil hypnotist has no idea that she is the descendent of a horrifying prehistoric sea monster, which she reverts back to when she is mesmerized by her boss. Unbeknownst to the hypnotist however, each time she is in the killer monster’s guise she becomes more skilled at controlling it. Immensely enjoyable 1950s ‘creature feature’ that boasts one of the most impressive monster costumes created in the B-Grade horror era. Cast includes Chester Morris and Marla English.

results.title: The Shawshank redemption (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Niki Marvin and Frank Darabont
results.brief_description: An unforgettable story of hope, friendship and survival inside a maximum security gaol. Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a New England banker convicted of murdering his wife and her lover, is sent to Shawshank State Prison where he meets “Red” Redding (Morgan Freeman), a seasoned lifer. Despite twenty years on the inside, the prison bars fail to contain their spirits and the pair forge an unlikely friendship that overcomes pain, suffering and ultimately leads to a chance at freedom.

results.title: The Shattered silence
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Howe and Morton Parker
results.brief_description: A film about noisy adolescents, motorcycles, and the tendency of some adults to make blanket judgments without troubling to know the facts. The film is designed to prompt discussion of what youngsters and their elders have a right to expect of each other. It touches on some basic principles of democracy and raises questions about the problem of communication between the generations. Cast includes: Bernard Behrens, Anthony Brown, Vernon Chapman, Lawrence Cherniak, Mignon Elkins, Eric Endersby, Cec Linder.

results.title: The Sharks
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Nicolas Noxon
results.brief_description: Not all sharks are dangerous to humans. Observing sharks around the world, the film addresses humankind’s fear and hatred of sharks and offers facts - about the shark’s anatomy, behaviour, and vulnerability to people.
results.description: Not all sharks are dangerous to humans. Observing sharks around the world, the film addresses humankind’s fear and hatred of sharks and offers facts - about the shark’s anatomy, behaviour, and vulnerability to people.

results.title: The Sharkcallers of Kontu
results.creator_credit: O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies and Dennis O'Rourke
results.brief_description: In a few villages on the west coast of Papua New Guinea a handful of men still practise the ancient ritual of sharkcalling. Colonisation and economic exploitation is slowly bringing to a close this spectacular and dangerous ritual. Dennis O’Rourke lived with the people to learn about sharkcalling and to understand the forces affecting their culture. Edited by Stewart Young. Photographed by Dennis O’Rourke and Chris Owen.

results.title: The Shape of things
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marcel Martin and Jacques Giraldeau
results.brief_description: An international symposium on sculpture held in Montreal in the mountain park overlooking the city. Follows the work of eleven sculptor from nine countries as they chip, chisel and hammer. Shows their finished sculptures left in the park for the pleasure of passers-by.
